intro: Hydrangea opuloides var. mandschurica, commonly known as the Mandschurian hydrangea, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It features large, showy inflorescences that can range from white to pink or blue depending on soil pH. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and has compound leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade. This variety is valued for its ornamental qualities and adaptability to temperate climates.
